text: Im trying to find a better way for internal submissions for blog posts (as some people dont login to HubSpot ever) :disappointed:
what do you all do from an internal standpoint, do have people login and write their posts in HS? Or, do you have folks send you word docs and such
for at least one project we use an API call from another solution where the posts are being curated as well as manually added.

Unless the client has some specific reason to NOT be in HubSpot, I try forcing them to use the CMS (since I can make a lot of changes to the modules / templating to suit their needs) whereas with an external editor there's less control over meta information and interface
Could try Zapier posting of content as well
The formatting / selection of appropriate content fields from integrations is getting way better there
You can also do processing and cleanup on them with some intermediary steps

We've had that struggle. I thought composition mode would be the cure, but for whatever reason we've found writers have a hard time giving up Word. We forced a change to Google Docs because we already had GSuite and were running into version control issues with local Word files, but even that was pushing it, and it still copies in some bad code sometimes. 

It works well enough for us now, but I've always thought some kind of WYSIWYG that output to markdown would be something worth researching.
copy from word into a text editor, then into HubSpot
also in google docs there is a way to turn off weird " quotes that are curly. Each person will need to do that.  That prevents &nbsp; type codes in meta descriptions
Those are the ways we've found work best to not have crap pasted into your HubSpot
